name: Plover Parametrics
headline: Climate change insurance that pays out immediately.
description:
The insurance industry struggles to insure new risks like climate change. The amount of climate risk that goes uninsured every year is $180 billion and growing. 

Plover's software platform enables insurers to design new insurance products quicker and manage policies cheaper, unlocking new risk markets and geographies.

Plover's team previously worked together at Palantir, handling data infrastructure for the US Department of Defense.

founders.name: Max Clarke, Founder
founders.description: Max studied History at Northwestern and Law at the University of Michigan. He spent 4 years practicing law (M&A and insurance regulatory work) before moving to Palantir, where he led business development efforts and implementation teams at the DoD and federal civilian agencies.

founders.name: Tommy Peeples, Founder
founders.description: Tommy studied Physics at Harvard. He spent over four years at Palantir working on projects in the Defense, Intel, and Commerce spaces. He’s also a classically trained violinist and directed the Harvard mariachi band.

founders.name: Ranajay Sen, Founder
founders.description: Ranajay studied undergraduate and graduate Computer Science at Stanford University, before working at Palantir Technologies for over 6 years. He served as Enterprise Technical Lead of Palantir’s law enforcement portfolio and led projects in federal defense, justice, and health.

# A Specialty Brokerage For Alternative Risk
Plover helps agents and brokers win new business and retain clients by offering parametric solutions for NatCat, weather, and novel risks.

## FAQs
What is Plover?
Plover is a specialty broker helping agents close hard-to-place accounts. Plover uses technology to quantify exposures, recommend products and market renewals. We make it easier for brokers to access specialty products and win renewals in hard markets.
What types of risks does Plover place?
See the menu for a list of available perils and some target verticals. These lists are not exhaustive and we may be able to place other risk in the P&C space.
How do I request a quote?
Email us at quote@plover.insure.
Attach a rough description of your risk via email. Agents can include documentation relevant to the risk (e.g., an SOV, ACORDs, supplemental apps, loss runs, an expiring policy, etc).
How soon will I get a response? 
Plover aims to respond to all submissions via email or phone within 48 hours.
Is Plover a comparative rater?
No. Plover’s team of licensed brokers supports submission flow by using software to assist in product and coverage recommendations. Plover’s brokers can evaluate exposures quickly and help retailers differentiate with access to specialty products. Plover trades with markets rated A or higher.
What is the cost of working with Plover?
There is no cost to receive a risk analysis or to send in a submission. Plover works off a competitive commission split structure for bound business, shared between Plover and our trading partners.
Where is Plover licensed?
We are currently licensed in 48 states. See state-by-state license information on our [licenses page](https://plover.insure/</licenses>).
How do I get in touch with a broker?
Please connect with Plover at our [contact page](https://plover.insure/</contact>).
## Get Started With Plover
[schedule A CALL](https://plover.insure/</contact>)
Plover Underwriting Services, Inc. (Plover) is a general agent for insurance companies. Plover is licensed as a property casualty and surplus lines insurance agency in all states in which insurance is offered and such licenses are necessary to offer this insurance. Availability and qualification for coverage, terms, rates and discounts may vary by jurisdiction. See our state license numbers.

See the menu for a list of available perils and some target verticals. These lists are not exhaustive and we may be able to place other risk in the P&C space.

Attach a rough description of your risk via email. Agents can include documentation relevant to the risk (e.g., an SOV, ACORDs, supplemental apps, loss runs, an expiring policy, etc).
How soon will I get a response? 
Plover aims to respond to all submissions via email or phone within 48 hours.
Is Plover a comparative rater?
No. Plover’s team of licensed brokers supports submission flow by using software to assist in product and coverage recommendations. Plover’s brokers can evaluate exposures quickly and help retailers differentiate with access to specialty products. Plover trades with markets rated A or higher.
What is the cost of working with Plover?
There is no cost to receive a risk analysis or to send in a submission. Plover works off a competitive commission split structure for bound business, shared between Plover and our trading partners.
Where is Plover licensed?

How do I get in touch with a broker?
Please connect with Plover at our contact page⟨18⟩.
## Get Started With Plover
schedule A CALL⟨18⟩
Plover Underwriting Services, Inc. (Plover) is a general agent for insurance companies. Plover is licensed as a property casualty and surplus lines insurance agency in all states in which insurance is offered and such licenses are necessary to offer this insurance. Availability and qualification for coverage, terms, rates and discounts may vary by jurisdiction. See our state license numbers.

generated_description:
**Plover Parametrics: A Fresh Take on Insurance for a Changing Climate**

Founded in 2022 and hailing from New York, Plover Parametrics is tackling a pressing issue in the insurance landscape: the inadequacy of coverage for climate-related risks. With a staggering **$180 billion** in climate risks left uninsured annually, Plover aims to fill this gap by harnessing technology to deliver **immediate payouts** for insured events, transforming the way we think about and approach insurance.

### Mission
At its core, Plover's mission revolves around climate change insurance that pays out immediately. Their innovative approach not only provides peace of mind but also ensures that policyholders can weather the storms, literally and figuratively.

### The Team
The brain behind Plover comes from an impressive background, with its team members previously collaborating at **Palantir**, where they managed data infrastructures for the US Department of Defense. This depth of experience informs their sophisticated software platform, designed to enable insurers to create and manage policies more effectively—unlocking new risk markets and geographies in the process.

### Y Combinator & Growth
Plover Parametrics is a proud member of Y Combinator's **W22 batch**, marking a significant step in its journey. With a compact yet mighty team of six, they're poised for growth, supported by their Group Partner **Dalton Caldwell**.

### Products & Target Markets
Plover is more than just an insurance broker; they’re a **specialty brokerage** focused on alternative risk solutions. Their offerings span various sectors, including:

- **High Net Worth**
- **Logistics**
- **Hospitality**
- **Energy**
- **Agriculture**
- **Healthcare**
- **Real Estate**

They also cover a wide range of perils such as **named storms, earthquakes, wildfires, floods, tornadoes, and hail**, addressing the unique risks faced by these diverse industries.

### How It Works
Plover utilizes advanced software for efficient risk analysis and backtesting. This means agents can transparently see how an earthquake policy would have functioned historically, enabling better decision-making for future coverage. Their platform is aimed at bringing clarity to brokers working in challenging market conditions.

### Accessing Their Services
Plover makes it straightforward to engage with their services. Brokers can submit inquiries quickly, and the company promises to respond within **48 hours**. They operate in **48 states**, making their innovative approach to insurance broadly accessible.

For anyone navigating the complexities of climate risk insurance, Plover Parametrics represents a forward-thinking solution anchored in data-driven insights—ready to take on the challenges of our rapidly changing environment. 

For more information, visit their [website](https://plover.insure).
